title: The Hela cell strain: cervical carcinoma
subject_group: Education, Instruction, Teaching & Schools/Biology - Study and teaching
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cells
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Cervix uteri - Cancer
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Human physiology
Mathematics, Science & Technology/Biology - Study and teaching
description: Part of the Living Human Cells in Culture series. The film is introduced with a sequence of tissue preparation for photography, and then shows the physiological characteristics of Hela cells, a malignant strain of cervical origin. Among the processes shown are cell drinking, nuclear rotation, mitosis and the action of filapodia in intercellular communications.
